text: The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want. He makes me lie down in green pastures.
From the rising of the sun to its setting, the name of the Lord is to be praised.
But they who wait for the Lord shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings like eagles.
If some of the branches have been broken off, and you, though a wild olive shoot, have been grafted in among the others and now share in the nourishing sap from the olive root.
I am the vine; you are the branches. If you remain in me and I in you, you will bear much fruit.
Mightier than the thunder of the great waters, mightier than the breakers of the seaâ€”the Lord on high is mighty.
Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow: they neither toil nor spin, yet I tell you, even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
And he brought him outside and said, 'Look toward heaven, and number the stars, if you are able to number them.' Then he said to him, 'So shall your offspring be.'
The Lord is my rock, my fortress and my deliverer; my God is my rock, in whom I take refuge.
I have set my rainbow in the clouds, and it will be the sign of the covenant between me and the earth.
There the angel of the Lord appeared to him in flames of fire from within a bush. Moses saw that though the bush was on fire it did not burn up.
The wicked flee though no one pursues, but the righteous are as bold as a lion.
Then they said, 'Come, let us build ourselves a city, with a tower that reaches to the heavens, so that we may make a name for ourselves.'
Then Moses stretched out his hand over the sea, and all that night the Lord drove the sea back with a strong east wind and turned it into dry land.
I will write on the tablets the words that were on the first tablets, which you broke. Then you are to put them in the ark.
When the Lord finished speaking to Moses on Mount Sinai, he gave him the two tablets of the covenant law, the tablets of stone inscribed by the finger of God.
We saw his star when it rose and have come to worship him.
He got up, rebuked the wind and said to the waves, 'Quiet! Be still!' Then the wind died down and it was completely calm.
And he took bread, gave thanks and broke it, and gave it to them, saying, 'This is my body given for you; do this in remembrance of me.'
'He is not here; he has risen, just as he said. Come and see the place where he lay.'
